description: Borrowed from Latin myosōtis, from Koine Ancient Greek μυοσωτίς (muosōtís, literally “ears of a mouse”), from genitive of μῦς (mûs, “mouse”) and nominative plural of οὖς (oûs, “ear”).

entries.meaning: Any plant of the genus Myosotis, the forget-me-nots.
examples: Cut all the myosotis there is.
